Key Arguments: The author believes that the claim that misinformation and disinformation pose a threat to Australians is itself disinformation.
The author values personal choice in consuming media and believes in the right to express opinions freely.
The author argues that everyone has different interpretations and opinions, and this diversity should be respected.
The author is concerned that controlling what people view equates to communism.
Notable Quotes: What a load of rubbish, these words (pose a threat to the safety and well being of Australians) are Just that disinformation.
The moment you have someone in the background in charge of what everyone views is the moment we have all lost. its called communism.
